column4: in rythm box, whenever I start the visualisation, it just exits without saying a word....  I get the same trouble trying to read a video DVD with totem (totem open and quit without saying anaything)
does it also say nothing, when you start for example totem from a terminal?
you mean starting totem and loading the DVD from the term??
opening a terminal, "totem", and then totem will perhaps output some error messages, that go to /dev/null, if startet from the graphical menu
ok, thanks!  I'm trying it and effectively I see the debug information on the terminal
libdvdread give me a bunch of errors....  I dont understant,because i installed libdvdcss2

hm, i don't know...  if that does not give enough information, you could try to run totem with strace to get a trace of all system calls and signals (those kill processes): "strace -f -o totem-trace totem"
It gives me a lot of info, but i dont know what to do with it... pretty new to linux
ok, then it's a bit difficult... if you want, you can try the strace thing and pastebin the resulting file "totem-trace"
it'S something like CHECK_VALUE failed in ifo read
that's from the output in the terminal, isn't it?
yes
the that will be file created if you run the strace command will contain the signal that is sent to the process, which is the reason why it crashes/ends suddenly. that may help to diagnose
sorry, messed up with the text ;)

next try: the file created with the strace command will contain the signal that is sent to the totem process. this signal is the reason why it crashes/ends suddenly. it may help to diagnose the problem
good, doing the trace thing
the trace thing seems to slow everything down... is it  normal?
yes ;)
you should try to crash the program as fast as possible to prevent the trace getting really huge...
the trace is done
ok, have you looked into it? if it is not too big, put it into pastebin, else only the last few hundred lines
have to leave...  job calls, but it's big  :p   so i'll see about it later
ok, bye
